KBRN, Lombok Tengah: Direktorat Jenderal Rehabilitasi Sosial Kementerian Sosial RI bekerjasama dengan Lembaga Kesejahteraan Sosial (LKS) Perkumpulan Panca Karsa (PPK) Mataram, Dinas Sosial Kabupaten Lombok Tengah, Dinas Sosial Kabupaten Lombok Barat, dan Dinas Sosial Provinsi NTB menyelenggarakan kegiatan Bimbingan Sosial.
Kegiatan ini diikuti oleh 490 Warga Negara Indonesia Migran Korban Perdagangan Orang (WNI M KPO) yang telah dipulangkan ke daerah asal. Tujuannya untuk memberikan pengetahuan, keterampilan kepada WNI M KPO agar mampu meningkatkan keberfungsian sosialnya di masyarakat serta mempunyai rintisan usaha untuk meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarga.
Direktur Jenderal Rehabilitasi Sosial, Edi Suharto Kamis (31/10/2019) memberikan arahan pada kegiatan Bimbingan Sosial bagi 340 WNI M KPO di Aula SMKN 1 Praya Kabupaten Lombok Tengah dan 150  WNI M KPO di Aula Rumah Makan Sukma Rasa Kabupaten Lombok Barat.
”Pemerintah telah berupaya untuk mengatasi permasalahan itu mulai dari hulu hingga hilir, meliputi rehabilitasi sosial, pemulangan dan reintegrasi sosial,”ungkapnya.
Pada kesempatan tersebut diberikan bantuan stimulan usaha kepada 340 WNI M KPO di Lombok Tengah sebesar Rp. 326.400.000,- dan 150 WNI M KPO di Lombok Barat Rp. 144.000.000,- melalui rekening masing-masing.
Total bantuan yang diberikan di kedua wilayah tersebut sebesar Rp. 470.400.000,-. Bimbingan sosial keterampilan yang diberikan terdiri dari kegiatan praktek kewirausahaan, praktek pengenalan produk, strategi memulai usaha dan strategi pemasaran.
“Sejak September 2015, WNI Migran bermasalah yang dideportasi dari Malaysia dan telah dipulangkan ke daerah asal tercatat sejumlah 62.729 orang. Provinsi NTB menempati urutan kedua  terbanyak WNI Migran bermasalah yang dipulangkan ke daerah asal yaitu sebanyak 3.768 orang,”sebutnya.
Menurut Edi, WNI M KPO yang dipulangkan ke daerah asal membutuhkan bantuan reintegrasi sosial yang dapat diakses untuk keberlanjutan kehidupan. Bantuan reintegrasi sosial berupa pelatihan ketrampilan hidup dan kesempatan ekonomi yang dapat memberikan peran yang penting dalam mendukung pemulihan dan reintegrasi bagi korban perdagangan orang/trafficking sebagai upaya mencegah terulangnya kembali menjadi korban (retraffick).
Edi Suarto menjelaskan, WNI M KPO yang dipulangkan ke daerah asal mengalami situasi berisiko yang berlanjut seperti: kekurangan informasi tentang akses bantuan, risiko dan masalah terkait pemulangan seperti jebakan hutang, disharmoni keluarga, retraffick/diperdagangkan kembali.
“beberapa resiko lainnya seperti kehilangan dokumen/identitas pribadi hingga mengalami sakit/disabilitas fisik, berlanjut tanpa bantuan, yaitu menjadi rentan diperdagangkan kembali karena tidak mendapat akses pekerjaan yang layak, situasi ekonomi yang memburuk serta jebakan/terlilit hutang,”tutup Edi.

Preventing Re-trafficking, Ministry of Social Affairs Guide 490 Indonesian Citizens Migrant Victims of Trafficking in Persons

KBRN, Central Lombok: The Directorate General of Social Rehabilitation of the Indonesian Ministry of Social Affairs in collaboration with the Social Welfare Institution (LKS) of the Mataram Parsa Association (PPK), the Social Service Office of Central Lombok Regency, the Social Service Office of West Lombok Regency, and the Social Service Office of the NTB Province organized Social Guidance activities.
This activity was attended by 490 Indonesian Citizens of Trafficking Victims (WNI M KPO) citizens who had been repatriated to their area of origin. The aim is to provide knowledge, skills to Indonesian citizen M KPO to be able to improve their social functioning in the community and have a business start-up to improve family welfare.
Director General of Social Rehabilitation, Edi Suharto, Thursday (10/31/2019) gave direction to the Social Guidance activities for 340 M KPO citizens in the Hall of SMKN 1 Praya, Central Lombok District and 150 M KPO citizens in the Hall of the West Lombok Sukma Rasa Restaurant.
"The government has tried to overcome these problems from upstream to downstream, including social rehabilitation, repatriation and social reintegration," he said.
On this occasion the business stimulant assistance was given to 340 Indonesian KPO citizens in Central Lombok in the amount of Rp. 326,400,000 and 150 Indonesian citizens M KPO in West Lombok Rp. 144,000,000 through their respective accounts.
Total assistance provided in the two regions was Rp. 470,400,000. The social guidance skills provided consist of entrepreneurial practice activities, product introduction practices, business start strategies and marketing strategies.
"Since September 2015, there are 62,729 people who have been deported from Malaysia and have been repatriated to their area of origin. "The province of NTB ranks second most of the problematic Indonesian citizens who have been repatriated to their area of origin, as many as 3,768 people," he said.
According to Edi, WNI M KPO who were repatriated to their area of origin needed social reintegration assistance that could be accessed for life sustainability. Social reintegration assistance in the form of life skills training and economic opportunities that can provide an important role in supporting the recovery and reintegration of trafficking victims as an effort to prevent a return of victims (retraffick).
Edi Suarto explained, KPI citizens who were repatriated to their area of origin experienced continuing risk situations such as: lack of information about access to assistance, risks and problems related to repatriation such as debt traps, family disharmony, retraffick / resold.
"Some other risks such as loss of documents / personal identity to experiencing physical illness / disability, continue without assistance, which is vulnerable to being traded again because they do not have access to decent work, a deteriorating economic situation and a trap / entwined with debt," concluded Edi.
